title: Sublime ancien village de Tenganan
content: We read online that this village is a must see. When we arrived a man came up and started escorting us around the village. He showed us his wife weaving on a loom. The shop is very close to the entrance. He and his wife immediately wanted us to buy some sarong. We told them we will come back. Through out the walk he kept getting us to buy baskets and other lunar calendars. The prices quoted were super high. Even if we come down to half it's still very expensive. We tried to offer them half of what they wanted and when they didn't want to sell we politely said :"Thank you" and walked away. The villagers will speak in their own language to scold us "cheap" or other demeaning words. We felt very uncomfortable. We felt we needed to buy something so as not to be scolded (not thick skin enough). Once we bought something we were treated like best friends. Our escort's wife told us she made all the cloths. I asked her :"you made this?" She said :"Yes, I made this for my daughter but I will just make another one". After we bought it we found a sewing that says "Ginaris" on the design when we got back to the hotel . Well we got lied to and scamed. Usually in the US if we buy art from indigenous people they don't lie about something being real. For example the Navajos jewelley sellers follow a code of conduct -- If it's not real turquoise they will tell the truth. We just didn't think the Balinese indigenous people would lie like that. It was a very bad experience for us.

title: Antikes Dorf mit sehenswerter Architektur
content: Amazing place and must visit. Had a little Balinese / Local snacks with great Bali Coffee. Great vibe as well

title: Villagio potretto da Hydra
content: Ich habe mir mal ein paar Bewertungen durchgelesen und musste teilweise herzlich lachen. Sicherlich ist es kein â€Fake Dorfâ€œ - es ist ein antikes Dorf. Die Dorfbewohner darin passen hier und da vielleicht nicht ganz ins authentisch, antike Bild, aber ist ein Dorf wie dieses dann automatisch fake? Wir hatten jedenfalls eine schÃ¶ne Zeit. Etwas lÃ¤stig ist, dass man an jeder Ecke von Einheimischen angesprochen wir, die einem etwas verkaufen wollen, aber das gehÃ¶rt eben dazu. Wir empfanden die Architektur als wirklich sehenswert. Das Zentrum der Stadt bildet eine lÃ¤ngliches GebÃ¤ude in welchem damals zeremoniellen Ereignisse stattgefunden haben. Beim nÃ¤chsten Besuch, buchen wir einen Guide, der uns etwas mehr zur Geschichte erzÃ¤hlen kann :)

title: pandan perang
content: Piccolo villagio comunitario  abitato da un gruppo che si narra discendere direttamente da Hydra che ha insegnato loro un molto particolare e molto difficile di tessere a doppia trama. Una tappa interessante

title: Highly recommend a visit
content: last year i visited tenganan village in November.this year i revisited Bali in June,and came to this village again.this time i came for pandan perang,or pandan war festival.Pandan war was carried out in order to honor the God of War, namely Indra. actually it is not the first time i watch pandan perang. but still want to see. it was hot that day.and the stage for pandan perang is crowded.my mobile phone felt hot too,the system warned me that i must keep it to a cold place.so i cant use it to take photos.luckily,i have other phone,so i wont miss the exiting scene.but this phone felt hot later,so i used my phone alternately.the padan war normally started at 14,00 ,and ended around 15,00, normally the festival is held in june.

title: basket,ikat,lontar and pandan war
content: Can't believe how many years I've been coming to Bali and not been here. Tenganan Dauh Tukad -- not to be confused with the Bali Aga village on Jalan Tenganan - is a beautiful gem. Peaceful - no traffic and so clean and tidy. Entrance fee by donation and taken around by a resident of the village who explained all about the history. Very interesting  and well worth the visit. No pressure into looking around and purchasing.

title: Da vedere...
content: last month i revisited here when i was going to candidasa,i had a tour with a driver. tenganan village is the last stop.i remembered the first time when i visited here,i bought a lontar painting book.on the second time i visited here,i bought a ikat weaving cloth. and i watched its famous pandan war twice.this time, i visited double ikat weaving workshop and ratten basket shop.i didnt buy any double ikat clothes,cuz the price quite expensive.but i bought two small rattern baskets,the seller explained to me why rattan basket is expensive,cuz  the quality is very good.i agreed with her.that day,i was the last traveller ,so the village is quiet,i felt comfortable.i will come here again,maybe watching pandan war again, or maybe shopping again,or just wandering around the village.

title: Ignore the negative reviews - this was a Bali highlight!
content: Abbiamo visitato questo antico villaggio insieme alla nostra guida Ari che ci ha spiegato come vivono, cosa producono etc. L'ingresso Ã¨ a offerta libera. Ci sono anche piccole botteghe dove poter comprare sarong, lavori fatti con il legno o bambÃ¹ etc. Siamo anche entrati in una casa privata durante la commemorazione di un defunto e l'ospitalitÃ  Ã¨ stata il top.

title: SpÃ¦ndende gÃ¥tur i smukke omgivelser
content: We visited on a hot sleepy afternoon - wonderful tranquil village where you can visit homes and learn about traditional crafts and ceremonies. Our guide was a really decent man and there was absolutely NO pressure to buy. It's a living village - not a museum - and a precious bit of Bali. Definitely recommend.

title: Alleen bijzonder tijdens festiviteiten. Only nice when there are festivities!
content: Nous avons eu la chance en allant dÃ©couvrir cet ancien village prÃ©servÃ© de tomber sur le tournage d'un clip pour une chanteuse Balinaise avec des jeunes filles et garÃ§ons habillÃ©s de maniÃ¨re traditionnelle avec de beaux costumes et aussi 2 couples de futurs mariÃ©s qui faisaient des photos en vue de leur mariageâ€¦.  un supplÃ©ment trÃ¨s agrÃ©able en plus de la visite de ce village tranquille

title: Tenganan - worth a visit!
content: Wij hebben Tenganan 2 maal bezocht. Toen er een bijzonder feest aan de gang was was het geweldig leuk om hier rond te kijken. De Bali Aga die hier leven horen bij de rijkeren van Bali. De bevolking is niet echt vriendelijk. Toen wij tijdens ons 2e bezoek aan Bali nog een keer dit dorpje bezochten was het uitgestorven, leuk om even rond te lopen maar Penglipuran bijvoorbeeld is dan interessanter. We visited Tenganan 2 times. The first time there were religious festivities so this was very nice to see. The Bali Aga people who live here are one of the richest in Bali. The second time we visited it was just a nice village to walk about, nothing extraordinary. The people don't talk to you (only when they want to sell souvenirs), not very nice. As a village Penglipuran is much more interesting to see.

title: Worth a visit!
content: This village is beautiful ( very photogenic!) The villagers still work on their craft as the have done for generations. Items cost a little more but having the opportunity to watch how much skill and patience go into a piece is priceless.  I was happy to pay for my double ikat and traditional calender stories, still barter but be reasonable. None of us want to work or create for nothing! The village was clean and tidy, the people were friendly and not at all pushy. We had young children with us, they were intrigued by the crafts and were not repremanded by locals when one young child chased the chickens! We left a donation on the way out.

title: UrsprÃ¼ngliches Bali hautnah
content: We were lucky enough to be shown around this ancient village from the 1600s by one of the elders. He was extremely informative and took us into his home to show us the traditional weaving done by his wife. The village is still functioning today. A very lovely stroll through a beautiful old village. You will need to provide a donation to be admitted to the village but this pays for your guide. If you want to see the more of the authentic Bali then add this to your bucket list.

title: Le plus vieux village de Bali
content: Wer einen kleinen Einblick in das ursprÃ¼ngliche Bali, abseits des Tourismus, haben mÃ¶chte, ist hier richtig. Sehr freundlich, nicht aufdringlich und sehr nette Leute.

title: Back to Bali Aga
content: TrÃ¨s joli village typique qui vit en quasi autarcie.Les villageois vous ferrons dÃ©couvrir leur village avec une visite guidÃ©e et vous montrerons les mÃ©tiers traditionnels de Bali: tissage etc...TrÃ¨s bel endroit, calme et reposant.

title: Village ancien
content: First visited this unique village in Bali in 1991 befriended by a leader in the village Wayan Terpi.Now sadly on the other side Heaven.  Privileged along with only a couple of other travellers to witness the fighting ritual festival where young men fight with cacti to win a young Maiden. A Highly colorful Festive day. A must to visit and wander around and learn from The True Balinese...A suitable donation should be left. Revisited July and talked with family members and very friendly locals.SPECIALğŸ™ğŸ˜€

title: Ã€ voir
content: Ã€ l'inverse des commentaires mentionnÃ©s sur ce village, nous avons Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s bien accueillis. Nous sommes arrivÃ©s avec notre guide (qui est restÃ© au parking) et nous avons payÃ© le droit d'entrÃ©e.  Ensuite 1 habitant du village nous a accompagnÃ© pour toute la visite. Nous avons pu voir comment les habitants y vivaient. Ce qui nous a impressionnÃ© c'est la balanÃ§oire... Des enfants sont montÃ©s dessus lorsque nous sommes arrivÃ©s, nous avons bien rigolÃ©s ensemble. Nous avons quand mÃªme eu droit Ã  une explication du tissage traditionnel pendant 10 minutes.  On nous a proposÃ© d'en acheter mais nous avons refusÃ© poliment... une visite agrÃ©able, si vous n'Ãªtes pas trop loin de ce village.

title: Educational village
content: Un petit cotÃ© piÃ¨ge Ã  touristes avec les fabrications des habitants Ã  acheter mais un cÃ´tÃ© authentique qui vaut le dÃ©tour, visite accompagnÃ©e par un des hanitants

title: Your donation won't get you out of the "hard sell"
content: They give you a tour guide if you give a small donation, which is really good as you learn all about the culture of the ancient village. They also sell crafts made in the village if you like shopping! Worth a visit to learn more about Balinese culture!

title: No
content: Don't go if you can help it. We thought paying a nice donation would avoid the "hard sell tactics" but we basically got taken to what seemed like a personal home to buy things. When we said we were here for a tour of the village and not to purchase anything it seemed the tour ended right there. So we stood awkwardly in the little street for a few minutes then just went back to the car and left.... it was a weird experience considering they are probably looking for touristic recommendations.

title: Quelque chose de diffÃ©rent
content: No me gustan este tipo de visitas a unos lugares preparados para turistas donde sus habitantes estÃ¡n siendo explotados artificialmente. Nooo

title: Keep driving
content: Le village est authentique et donne une idÃ©e de la culture de cette ethnie,maintenant reconvertie vers le tourisme au vue du nombre de boutiques Lâ€™endroit est trÃ¨s diffÃ©rent des autres villages de Bali , peu de sourire,et une ambiance assez hostile pour ma part

title: Vrijwel niks te zien
content: I cant say I know anymore upon leaving than I did on arriving.  Our driver took us here telling us it was a traditional village, like a working museum. When we got there we made an expected 'donation' which I'm happy to do.We were the only ones there so the village guy took us on a walk through the village.  A very slow walk with a couple of explanations of a few buildings that all seemed to have the same purpose.  We saw a couple of the village children but that was it apart from a few caged roosters (used for cock fighting) and a couple of buffalos.  The only building we were taken inside was a batik fabric place but it was literally just a shop, there was no demonstration or anyone doing anything inside the place. Bit of pressure to look/buy but we kept walking because we didnt find any of the pieces appealing.It could have been great, but its sadly lacking. If this is a working museum/village then there wasnt much working going on.  It could be beautiful even in an authentic way but it was quite boring because it was literally walking up one street and then down the other.  We didnt visit any homes or learn about any traditional crafts, cooking, music, art or anything else you would expect to at a traditional museum/village.

title: Fake Dorf
content: Er was letterlijk niks hier. Alleen maar winkeltjes. De mensen zitten buiten, op zich fotootje waard. Misschien dat met een hele bus erheen leuker is, met zn tweeÃ«n niet

title: Waste of time
content: Wir waren auch dort. Absoluter Fake. Die Frau am Webstuhl konnte das GerÃ¤t nicht einmal bedienen und erklÃ¤rte uns wie viel Schals sie produziert. Handys, Mopeds und StrassenhÃ¤ndler alles vertreten wie sonst Ã¼berall auf Bali.

title: Interesting but overshadowed by pressure to buy
content: I am  giving this 2 stars only because of the beautiful lush green surroundings is this village. Otherwise .. it was a complete waste and disappointing experience. Our local guide shared no information .. just took us inside a few home shops - where the residents seemed sad, distracted and disinterested.. the local architecture, layout - didnâ€™t provide any further insight or understanding of Old Balinese ways or anything. It actually makes me sad to give this poor review as I am guessing they depend on tourists. Hopefully  we just had a rare, below average experience.  We have visited many other similar and much more insightful and interesting village / traditional life experiences in Malaysia, Laos,  Vietnam and India .. this one doesnâ€™t even come close. My point - Donâ€™t sell yourself as an experience- if you arenâ€™t going  to even try. ..

title: Not that special place to visit
content: We went with a guide from our hotel. The village history and culture is interesting.Before we even got to the village, our guide was telling us that he would take us only to the best shop and there was absolutely no pressure to buy .. and acted quite offended at the thought. So he took us to a shop.... we surprised one of the males who was counting huge wads of rupiah. He disappeared pretty fast and a woman came to point at some of the textiles. They were no better than anywhere else - they also had the same tourist rubbish as other place. We asked where things were from... not even all of the textiles were locally made. When we said we weren't going to buy, the shop owner just walked away. Our guide was put out. We asked to go to smaller 'real' stores and he pretended not to understand. So we walked into another store but it was pretty much the same experience. The economic benefits of tourism are important and we happily buy for genuine articles- but this was just too cynical.

title: Not very interesting
content: I visited the village with a guide but did not get anything out of it. Many tourist shops and temple (of course) but nothing special.

title: Your donation won't get you out of the "hard sell"
content: I'm not jaded, but while I appreciate its historical significance, its not interesting to tour. Compound walls block most picturesque views of homes. Some invite you in to buy overpriced textiles. The guide seemed bored (we only donated 20,000 idr) and there was not much to see, no market, no people around..  I will concede that at festival times this would be good to visit. When we were in Ubud previously, we visited another village, that was quite picturesque and very photogenic. Unfortunately I can't remember its name.

title: Visit Tenganan if you enjoy being forced to buy extremely expensive rip offs and extortionate behavior
content: I'm not jaded, but while I appreciate its historical significance, its not interesting to tour. Compound walls block most picturesque views of homes. Some invite you in to buy overpriced textiles. The guide seemed bored (we only donated 20,000 idr) and there was not much to see, no market, no people around..  I will concede that at festival times this would be good to visit. When we were in Ubud previously, we visited another village, that was quite picturesque and very photogenic. Unfortunately I can't remember its name.

title: Felt like a movie set for a Balinese tv ad
content: Please read this.. The positive reviews can only come from those who purchased goods here. (ripped off as well as these goods are sold for 75k rdp in the many shops) Started very well with a lovely driver (who may or may not be a part of this scam) to the village.Once there we met a guide who was lovely and friendly. After a very interesting 5 minutes we were taken into a home with a variety of weaved items. Once there he told us an interesting tale of how it was made. He then told us the price despite numerously saying "you cannot buy" and when we politely declined... Everything changed.. His face dropped and all his apparent enthusiasm disappeared. What followed was thus far the most pitiful display of extortionate behavior. They slowly began packing up with him muttering his own language. After an uncomfortable 5 minutes we left and he led us back silent as the grave. I purposefully asked questions about the village only to get quick energy less answers. To be honest it was borderline hostile as he passed other villagers he spoke to them and we were in turn glared at like we were despicable creatures. As we left the guide smiled and waved in a very friendly way. Just in case the tourists who just arrived may be buying customers. In all honesty this is pathetic and a real damper on an otherwise great day. Do yourselves a favor.. Avoid this place.. Don't support this tourist scamBeautiful but no less so than so many other places here. Still would have loved that tour

title: Un attrape touriste
content: Visited this village without much expectation and was not disappointed by the lack of authenticity. We were led around by a local who gave us a fairly superficial description of the village before leading us to a relativeâ€™s souvenir shop. It felt very much like a movie set with nothing much happening until we approached. Each â€œhomeâ€ was in fact a souvenir shop with overpriced items (higher than other tourist traps e has visited). The fact became clear when we reached a point in the village where we were told e could go no further. Obviously this is where the village actually was, motorbikes, iPhones and all. The guide expressed surprise that we werenâ€™t going to buy any mementoes.

title: Geen omweg waard
content: Ce n'Ã©tait pas prÃ©vu dans notre circuit mais notre guide nous a emmenÃ© dans ce soit disant ancien village ayant gardÃ© toutes leurs traditions. Nous n'avons absolument pas aimÃ©. On remonte le village avec pleins de petits magasins. On cherche Ã  tout prix Ã  nous faire acheter des objets Ã  prix exorbitants. Rien de naturel, traditionnel mais plus un attrape touriste. Sentiment de mal-Ãªtre dans cet endroit.  Des villages dans la campagne sont tellement plus authentique. Nius avons Ã©tÃ© choquÃ© de voir des coqs de couleur vivant, juste pour les touristes. Ce village a perdu son Ã¢me.

title: Echt niets te zien
content: De village was rustig toen wij er al vroeg in de morgen waren. Geen toegangsprijs maar ze vragen wel om een gift. Op zich ok om even te kijken maar niet echt bijzonder. Uiteindelijk is het er op gericht dat je toch iets van de plaatselijke bevolking koopt. Geen mooie gebouwen of zo. Wat ons betreft geen omweg waard.

title: Only go if you want to buy something
content: Op papier lijkt het interessant, maar wij waren zo goed als de enige toeristen hier. We waren amper uitgestapt of alle verkopers begonnen al naar ons te roepen in de hoop dat we toch maar iets bij hen zouden kopen ... In het dorp zelf is er niets te zien, buiten enkele locals die hun waar aan de toeristen probeerden te verkopen. Wij hadden het gevoel in een soort niemandsland te zijn terechtgekomen.

title: Niet bijzonder
content: We organised a visit to Tenganan so we could enjoy a behind the scenes look at traditional life in Bali.I donâ€™t purchase things just for the sake of it so I never planned to buy anything at this village (unless of course I absolutely fell in love with something ... which I didnâ€™t).We were greeted by an initially very friendly local who happily took our donation to escort us around the village.We got a 5 minute talk about traditional culture in Tenganan and were then escorted into 2 different homes to view local products for sale. Once they realised we werenâ€™t interested in buying our guides demeanour quickly changed. He no longer bothered to talk to us and barely answered any questions that we asked and we were quickly escorted back to our driver and the tour was over.This had potential to be a good tour but it was a total waste of time and complete disappointment.It should be up to the visitors to choose if they want to purchase products without pressure.

title: super arnaque
content: Vanmiddag naar Tenganan geweest met mijn kleinzoon, omdat hij er nog niet eerder was geweest. Er waren helemaal geen toeristen, wij waren de enigen. Wij werden door een gids rondgeleid...tot in zijn eigen huis. Moeder die zou sarongs weven en tafellakens, maar...schets mijn verbazing dat daar dezelfde tafellakens lagen die ik op de markt in Singaraja heb gekocht voor 20.000 rph. Hier vroegen ze 150.000 rph. Mijn kleinzoon wilde wel een blijvende herinnering aan Bali en besloot om zijn naam in het Balinees op een palmbladeren met bamboo "blaadje" te laten schrijven. Kosten...400.000 rph. De man was wel heel erg aardig, maar verder...overslaan dit.

title: PÃ©simo y mal comportamiento.
content: ne pas confondre village prefere des franÃ§ais et plus beau village des franÃ§ais en effet il suffit de voter (moyennant qq poussous bien sur )  sachant qu'une personne peut voter autant de fois qu'elle le veut vous pensez bien que les villages situÃ©s en zone peu peuplÃ©es n'ont aucune chance faute d'electeur. a cassel en 2018 le maire a votÃ© au moins 50 fois je crois on le comprend on ajoute les cafes , restaurateurs etc etc qui ont un interet certain a ce que le village soit Ã©lu? Ã§a ne veut plus rien dire du tout.en tout cas le grand gagnant est certainement celui qui empoche le pognon.depuis je ne met plus les pieds a cassel qui est proche de chez moi.

title: Lied to and scamed by villagers!
content: Nos deja el GuÃ­a en la entrada Pagas como un donativo y te inscriben en un libro a la entrada,el GuÃ­a que tienes contratado no va contigo,pasas directamente con una persona que es del pueblo,te da una vuelta por dos calles y te lleva a su casaâ€A nosotros en particular nos enseÃ±o pareos y calendarios de madera,como solo se le compro un calendario y fue mÃ¡s que nada por hacerle ya un favor no le pareciÃ³ bien y con las mismas nos llevo hacia la puerta dando una vuelta por otras dos calles diferentes por las que no habÃ­amos pasado,sin dirigirnos la palabra,llegamos de nuevo a la salida y nosotros nos quedamos tan impactados con lo que habÃ­a pasado que mi percepciÃ³n de Bali cambiÃ³ en ese preciso instante,para mi gusto es patÃ©tica,de mal gusto,algo que te puedes ahorar en tiempo porque ver.... y me pareciÃ³ de mal gusto lo que se hizo con nosotros y por eso no se lo recomiendo a nadie ,quizÃ¡s si compras 3 pareos y 6 calendarios cambia la cosa,tengo que decir que como solo le cogÃ­amos el calendario le dimos por el,al cambio casi 15â‚¬, por hacerle un favor que a dÃ­a de hoy me arepiento y no le hubiera dejado nada.

title: æµ·æ´‹å…¬åœ’
content: In honesty it was my fault - my wife asked me if I wanted to go to Ocean Park in Hualien. In my mind I was assuming a actual park by the ocean.  Gotta do your research folks. Oh, how wrong I was! The bus dropped us off at the gate to this amusement park in the middle of nowhere resting on the side of a hill and ocean... the beautiful blue ocean can be seen but it is fairly far away to walk to and touch. Due to man made obstacles everywhere on the thin shoreline.  There was a parking lot in the distance with access but was quite a hike if you wanted to get there. We didn't.  So lets go into this theme park since we are here and the bus to make our escape is another hour or two.  From outside the gate.. its very well maintained, and fun music is playing OVER AND OVER AND OVER their theme song. You start to get excited since looking up the hill it looks like a magical place stuffed with FUN! BZZZZZZZZZZZ! WRONG. This money maker for the owners only. At roughly $30 a person, $20 something for a child you are allowed entrance into a theme park that offers roughly 5 working rides out of 8. Two dolphins that swim around in a pool sadly. A log floom ride that was not very steep and probably the only highlight of a ride here for an adult. There is a castle - closed. The rollercoaster looks rusty and was closed. The shops are dull and lifeless. A reminder this is on a hill, your best bet is to take the gondola to the top and walk your way down.. or for some unknown reason you end up walking around in this theme park on deserted steep inclined roads with a few bushes and flowers on each side for long stretches of boredom before reaching the next plateau of hell. An adult could realistically finish this place in under 30 minutes. The food is expensive and greasy. The shops are generic with little items branded for the park. You do however get a $100NT voucher for food or a gift with your paid ticket. So we got a magnet of a fish. Maybe they do feel guilty? Now if you are 8 years old you will think this is the greatest theme park in the world... for Taiwan. Unless you never been to a theme park in your life ( a child, obviously.) do not go here. Save your money. If you still have an urge for a theme park.. check out the one in Sun Moon Lake.

title: Family Fun in Hualien
content: æµ·æ´‹åŠ‡å ´çš„è¡¨æ¼”ï¼Œèƒ½å¤ è®“å…¨å¹´é½¡å±¤çš„è§€çœ¾ç•™ä¸‹æ·±åˆ»å°è±¡ã€‚èƒ½å¤ åŠæ—©å…¥å ´ï¼Œé€—ç•™æ™‚é–“å¤ é•·ï¼Œæ‰èƒ½æœ‰æ•ˆçš„äº«å—å…¨å ´åŸŸè¨­æ–½åŠæ´»å‹•ã€‚

title: åœ¨å¤ªå¹³æ´‹ä¸Šçš„æµ·æ´‹å…¬åœ’
content: We took our 5 year old and 3 year old here on a weekday and they had a blast! The rides are designed for smaller children and the aquarium is filled with different types of fish and mammals. Our cab driver informed us prices recently went back to normal after pandemic-level lows and the park was not crowded.The park is stroller friendly and you can rent a large stroller for $100 NTD. Please note they do not have a double stroller option so if you need a stroller for 2 children bring your own.Half of the park is closed but there are still plenty of food concessions and gift shops.  The day we visited the credit card system was down so concessions were cash only. This ended up not being a massive hinderance to us and since Taiwan is still a largely cash based society you should carry cash with you as a habit.We read earlier reviews that the food was terrible. In our experience it was perfectly fine and we had no issues.We missed the Seal and Castle shows but the leaping dolphin performance is impressive.  Disclaimer: I do not know how the performance animals were obtained and cannot speak to the ethics behind it.All in all a good experience if you find yourself in Hualien with children. I wouldnâ€™t recommend traveling from Taipei just to see the park since Taipei has other child-friendly options.

title: Amusement Aquarium

title: å¥‡å¦™æ…¶å…¸è¡¨æ¼”ç§€å€¼å¾—ä¸€çœ‹
content: This place was more an amusement park rather than an aquarium. There were some fish and other marine life, but it felt like there were more rides.  Let's start with the positives.  The park was located in a great area with an awesome view.  There was a little something for everyone. If you wanted to see marine life, they had it. If you wanted to see pinnipeds, they had them. If you wanted rides (water rides, roller coasters, ferris wheel, etc), they had those. And they also had a few shows to entertain the kids.  Now the negative.  The park is old.  The food options, although plentiful, were not good. All in all, not a bad place to visit, but I wouldn't drive out here just for the park. Unless you're close by.

The dolphins, sea lions, and seals here are very cute, and every trainer works very hard. The aquarium is also decorated beautifully. We can see many underwater animals; I also saw my favorite starfish and Nemo fish there. I also take the cable car, because I like the feeling of looking down in the sky. We also have lunch at the restaurant, although it was a little expensive, we still feel very happy. title: å®¶æ—ä¾†æ…¶ç”Ÿä¹‹æ—…
content: In honesty it was my fault - my wife asked me if I wanted to go to Ocean Park in Hualien. In my mind I was assuming a actual park by the ocean.  Gotta do your research folks. Oh, how wrong I was! The bus dropped us off at the gate to this amusement park in the middle of nowhere resting on the side of a hill and ocean... the beautiful blue ocean can be seen but it is fairly far away to walk to and touch. Due to man made obstacles everywhere on the thin shoreline.  There was a parking lot in the distance with access but was quite a hike if you wanted to get there. We didn't.  So lets go into this theme park since we are here and the bus to make our escape is another hour or two.  From outside the gate.. its very well maintained, and fun music is playing OVER AND OVER AND OVER their theme song. You start to get excited since looking up the hill it looks like a magical place stuffed with FUN! BZZZZZZZZZZZ! WRONG. This money maker for the owners only. At roughly $30 a person, $20 something for a child you are allowed entrance into a theme park that offers roughly 5 working rides out of 8. Two dolphins that swim around in a pool sadly. A log floom ride that was not very steep and probably the only highlight of a ride here for an adult. There is a castle - closed. The rollercoaster looks rusty and was closed. The shops are dull and lifeless. A reminder this is on a hill, your best bet is to take the gondola to the top and walk your way down.. or for some unknown reason you end up walking around in this theme park on deserted steep inclined roads with a few bushes and flowers on each side for long stretches of boredom before reaching the next plateau of hell. An adult could realistically finish this place in under 30 minutes. The food is expensive and greasy. The shops are generic with little items branded for the park. You do however get a $100NT voucher for food or a gift with your paid ticket. So we got a magnet of a fish. Maybe they do feel guilty? Now if you are 8 years old you will think this is the greatest theme park in the world... for Taiwan. Unless you never been to a theme park in your life ( a child, obviously.) do not go here. Save your money. If you still have an urge for a theme park.. check out the one in Sun Moon Lake.
